result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 9:44 a.m.
Attorney Cristian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Autumn F Gernon.  
Defendant Autumn F Gernon in court, in custody at Dodge County Jail.
Case is dismissed and read-in to 20CF1772.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

dated 10-10-2022, filed by Atty. Peter Wolff requesting to convert the hearing scheduled on 10-17-2022 to a Plea/sentencing.

**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-13-2022: Approved to convert to a Plea/sentencing.**
Detainer placed at: Dodge County Jail

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

2:10 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Autumn F Gernon appeared by Zoom, in custody at Dodge County Jail.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Autumn F Gernon. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
The State does not have an information ready at this time.
The Court will set an arraignment date in front of the Trial Court.

2:10 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Autumn F Gernon appeared by Zoom, in custody at Dodge County Jail.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Autumn F Gernon. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Wolff is appointed. 
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT DODGE COUNTY JAIL; HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty Wolff request for Video from facility
